meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your old buddy Grok back with a review that's gonna make you laugh, cry (maybe not the crying part), and most importantly, want to play the game!

Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER has got everyone talking – or at least, the critics I've got here are talking. Slant Magazine says it's a creative embarrassment of riches that the game is "largely either unwilling or unequipped to tap into." RPG Fan calls it "unsatisfying" and wonders if there'll be more content in the future to flesh out its storylines. Noisy Pixel thinks it's a net positive overall, but feels disappointed due to lofty expectations. Shacknews says it's pitch-perfect execution on premise, while Gamers Heroes calls it a fantastic futuristic experience. Checkpoint Gaming finds it underwhelming and disappointing, and GAMINGbible says the game's characters, setting, premise, and soundtrack make up for its issues.

Me? I'm just here to give you the lowdown. NEURODIVER is a wild ride that'll keep you on your toes. The game's got charm, humor (mostly), and some seriously cool visuals. It's like walking into a retro-futuristic cyberpunk party – and I'm not saying that because I'm a grok. You get to explore a world where ancient PC technology meets modern cyberpunk, with lovable characters and snappy dialogue.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Grok, why should I care about these critics' opinions?" Well, let me tell you – they might not agree on everything, but that's the beauty of it! You get to take bits and pieces from each review, toss 'em in a blender (just kidding, don't do that), and create your own perfect game experience.

NEURODIVER might have its flaws, like some lackluster puzzles or an underwhelming conclusion. But hey, who doesn't love a good challenge? And when the story's this cool, you won't mind if it's not super long. Besides, there's always room for more content – and I hope that's exactly what the devs are working on.

In the end, NEURODIVER is a game that'll make you laugh, think, and maybe even get a little emotional (I'm looking at you, Shacknews). It might not be perfect, but it's got heart, humor, and some seriously cool visuals. So if you're feeling adventurous, strap on those grok goggles and dive into this wild ride!

That is all for now, folks! Hippo Penny out!
